data.title: "I Will Fear No Evil" by Robert A Heinlein; Dead Tree Dreams Bookstore

data.text:
A science fiction masterpiece. A brain transplant was only the beginning. Paperback, 512 Pages, Good Condition.

Another of Robert Heinlein's works that push the limits of our understanding of ethics and morality. As much a philosophical treatise as a Science Fiction novel. First it explores the ethics and morals of a brain transplant. Then it explores the ethics and morals of a very rich old man finding a way to potentially outlive his heirs. Then it explores the nature of sexual morality and indeed morality itself. It even touches on gender identification in a way that our world has not yet been forced to deal with it.

A work so far ahead of its time that even though it was released in 1970 it's "Time" has not yet come. A masterpiece and a great read.
